intro: Tribulus solandri, commonly known as the velvet tamarisk, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Zygophyllaceae family and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with small, ovate leaflets. Tribulus solandri is often found in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting well to harsh, dry conditions.
